result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeremiah J. Fischer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jeremiah J. Fischer is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Jeremiah J. Fischer was found guilty of Fraud. Tapping/Wires/Meters/Pipes(Other) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class C misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.36(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Outstanding financial obligations are not a condition of probation & are to be paid directly to the Shawano Co Clerk of Court office within 30 days.  Debts older than 60 days will be processed for tax intercept & civil judgments.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  Payment plans available for qualifying amounts.

All financials same as noted above.
Defendant to submit DNA sample.

Defendant enters a plea of no contest to Count 2.  Court advises party of their rights, finds factual basis, accepts defendant's waiver of their rights, the plea made, and finds guilty.  Count 1 dismissed.  Admits to prior record.  Citizenship and probation info provided.  Arguments as to penalty.  Court order $10 + costs, DNA sample.  Appeal rights.

Defendant Jeremiah J. Fischer in court with attorney Jeremey Michael Campshure.  Defendant Jeremiah J. Fischer in custody.  Scott E. Niemi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a plea of not guilty.  Defendant has not yet signed his signature bond.  Clerk ot send over to Jail.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 8, 2016 at 10:00 am.
